Package org.waltonrobotics.motion

Class Line

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.waltonrobotics.motion.Path
      • org.waltonrobotics.motion.BezierCurve
        • org.waltonrobotics.motion.Line
  • public class Line
extends BezierCurve

    This Path creates a straight line using the BezierCurve class.

    Author:
    Russell Newton, Walton Robotics
    See Also:
    BezierCurve

    • Constructor Detail

      • Line

        public Line​(double vCruise,
            double aMax,
            double startVelocity,
            double endVelocity,
            boolean isBackwards,
            PathData startPathData,
            Pose startPose,
            Pose endPose)
        Be careful when using this. If your robot's angle is off, the MotionContoller will try to correct for it, so you will not get a straight line.
        Parameters:
        vCruise - the cruise velocity of the robot
        aMax - the maximum acceleration of the robot
        startVelocity - the start velocity
        endVelocity - the end velocity
        isBackwards - whether or not to move the robot backwards
        startPathData - the starting PathData for the Line. This can provide a starting time.
        startPose - the starting Pose. Angle doesn't matter
        endPose - the ending Pose. Angle doesn't matter

      • Line

        public Line​(double vCruise,
            double aMax,
            double startVelocity,
            double endVelocity,
            boolean isBackwards,
            Pose startPose,
            Pose endPose)
        Be careful when using this. If your robot's angle is off, the MotionContoller will try to correct for it, so you will not get a straight line.
        Parameters:
        vCruise - the cruise velocity of the robot
        aMax - the maximum acceleration of the robot
        startVelocity - the start velocity
        endVelocity - the end velocity
        isBackwards - whether or not to move the robot backwards
        startPose - the starting Pose. Angle doesn't matter
        endPose - the ending Pose. Angle doesn't matter

      • Line

        public Line​(double vCruise,
            double aMax,
            double startVelocity,
            double endVelocity,
            boolean isBackwards,
            Pose startPose,
            double distance)
        Be careful when using this. If your robot's angle is off, the MotionContoller will try to correct for it, so you will not get a straight line.
        Parameters:
        vCruise - the cruise velocity of the robot
        aMax - the maximum acceleration of the robot
        startVelocity - the start velocity
        endVelocity - the end velocity
        isBackwards - whether or not to move the robot backwards
        startPose - the starting Pose. Angle doesn't matter
        distance - how you wish to offset the startingPose from.
